company_name_alias: dsp has been a game changer for ad security
description:
For security teams charged with defending hybrid and multi-cloud environments, Semperis ensures the integrity and availability of critical enterprise directory services at every step in the cyber kill chain and cuts recovery time by 90%. Purpose-built for securing hybrid identity environments‚Äîincluding Active Directory, Entra ID, and Okta‚ÄîSemperis‚Äô AI-powered technology protects over 100 million identities from cyberattacks, data breaches and operational errors. The world‚Äôs leading organizations trust Semperis to spot directory vulnerabilities, intercept cyberattacks in progress and quickly recover from ransomware and other data integrity emergencies. Semperis is headquartered in Hoboken, New Jersey, and operates internationally, with its research and development team distributed throughout the United States, Canada and Israel.

Semperis hosts the award-winning Hybrid Identity Protection conference and podcast series (www.hipconf.com) and built the community hybrid Active Directory cyber defender tools, Purple Knight (www.semperis.com/purple-knight/) and Forest Druid. The company has received the highest level of industry accolades, recently named to Inc. Magazine‚Äôs list of best workplaces for 2024 and ranked the fastest-growing cybersecurity company in America by the Financial Times. Semperis is a Microsoft Enterprise Cloud Alliance and Co-Sell partner and is a member of the Microsoft Intelligent Security Association (MISA).
description_enriched: Semperis is a comprehensive Active Directory security and recovery platform that protects hybrid AD environments from identity-based attacks.
description_metadata_raw: Semperis is the industry's most comprehensive Active Directory security and recovery platform, protecting hybrid AD environments from identity-based attacks.

company_updates.description:
That ‚Äúdo not remove‚Äù label? A classic example.

We‚Äôre wired to avoid conflict, even when something feels off.

Social engineers count on that instinct for us to trust instructions.

A healthy dose of skepticism can make all the difference in building human resilience.

Thanks to Rob Shapland for sharing
company_updates.reshared_post_description:
Are you thinking enough about physical access‚Äînot just cyber?

Ethical hacker Rob Shapland reveals how real-world breaches often start long before any device is touched. Recon is the art of observation‚Äîtracking arrival patterns, spotting weak entry points, and mapping human behavior. Then comes pretexting: a believable story, the appropriate uniform, and the confidence to walk straight through the door. 

In this clip, Rob breaks down how attackers scope a target and turn social engineering into physical access‚Äîand what defenders should be watching for. A must-see for anyone focused on the human layer of risk.

Action Partners: CyberRisk Alliance (CRA), Cyber Future Foundation (CFF), the Institute for Critical Infrastructure Technology (ICIT), ISC2 Eastern Massachusetts Chapter, the Michigan Council of Women in Technology Foundation (MCWT), and WiCyS Delaware Valley

#MidnightInTheWarRoom #CyberSecurity #DefendersUnite #SocialEngineering

company_updates.description:
When Active Directory goes down, everything stops:
 ‚ùå Users can‚Äôt log in
 ‚ùå Services are unreachable
 ‚ùå Data access grinds to a halt

No wonder Active Directory is a top target for ransomware. Every second counts when your identity system is compromised, and manual recovery can take days, leaving your business exposed to lingering malware and backdoors.

‚úÖ The smarter approach: Automate your AD Forest Recovery with Semperis

Semperis helps organizations restore hybrid AD environments up to 90% faster, saving an average of $3.9M over 3 years reducing downtime and saving millions in potential losses.

If AD went down today, how fast could you recover?
üëâ Book a 1:1 call with an AD recovery expert: https://okt.to/Qrku0p

New technical research for identity defenders: Ghost SPNs + Kerberos reflection can enable remote SYSTEM-level escalation‚Äîespecially where SMB signing isn‚Äôt enforced and default DNS permissions remain unchanged.

Microsoft has addressed the SMB server elevation path (CVE‚Äë2025‚Äë58726), but stale SPNs and permissive defaults still expose identity infrastructure.

Our blog breaks down the attack flow and mitigations: enforce SMB signing, audit and clean SPNs, restrict DNS writes, and monitor suspicious TGS requests.

Read the full analysis: https://okt.to/osWrP8

#ActiveDirectory #IdentitySecurity #CyberDefense

#TuesdayTip #CybersecurityTip #CyberCrisisReadiness

üîí Cybersecurity Industry Watch: Weekly Highlights üîí
It‚Äôs Monday ‚Äî here are three critical developments every CISO should note this week:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Nation-State Breach Hits U.S. Telecom Vendor
A U.S. company with privileged access to major telecom carriers uncovered a breach attributed to a nation-state actor. The intrusion targeted sensitive systems that manage network infrastructure, raising concerns about espionage and potential disruption of critical communications.
Source: https://okt.to/Ag1VK0
‚û°Ô∏è Actionable insights: Audit vendor access and enforce least privilege. Monitor supply-chain integrations for anomalies. Update incident response plans for telecom dependencies.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Ransomware Actors Abuse Remote Access Tools
Threat actors are increasingly leveraging legitimate remote access tools (RATs) to infiltrate enterprise environments and deploy ransomware. This tactic bypasses traditional detection methods, making remote work and IT support channels prime targets.
Source: https://okt.to/5o1TRh
‚û°Ô∏è Actionable Insights: Restrict and monitor remote access usage. Deploy behavioral analytics for suspicious sessions. Enforce MFA and detailed session logging.

3Ô∏è‚É£ FCC Proposes Rollback of Telecom Cybersecurity Rules
FCC leadership seeks to eliminate certain cybersecurity requirements for telecommunications carriers, arguing they impose unnecessary burdens. Critics warn this could weaken defenses against nation-state and criminal threats targeting critical infrastructure.
Source: https://okt.to/wloNyu
‚û°Ô∏è Actionable Insight: Track regulatory changes impacting telecom security. Maintain best practices even if compliance rules ease.

Stay informed to stay secure. What stories are catching your attention this week?

üîé ùêçùêûùê∞ ùêëùêûùê¨ùêûùêöùê´ùêúùê° ùêÄùê•ùêûùê´ùê≠ ùêüùê´ùê®ùê¶ ùêíùêûùê¶ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¢ùê¨
Today, we‚Äôre releasing our latest research into a critical flaw in Windows Server 2025 exposing managed service accounts to Golden dMSA attack.

Why it matters:
Golden dMSA exploits a cryptographic vulnerability in the ManagedPasswordId structure used by dMSAs. Because this structure includes predictable, time-based elements with only 1,024 possible combinations, attackers can brute-force service account passwords quickly. This opens the door for:

‚úÖ Cross-domain lateral movement
‚úÖ Persistent, undetected access to all managed service accounts and their resources across Active Directory
‚úÖ Long-term compromise of critical infrastructure

To help defenders and researchers understand and simulate this attack in real-world environments, Semperis Researcher Adi Malyanker developed a new tool called GoldenDMSA. The tool incorporates the logic of the attack, enabling security teams to study, evaluate, and proactively defend against this emerging threat.

‚ÄúGolden dMSA exposes a critical design flaw that could let attackers generate service account passwords and persist undetected in Active Directory environments. I built a tool that helps defenders and researchers better understand the mechanism of the attack. Organizations should proactively assess their systems to stay ahead of this emerging threat,‚Äù said Malyanker. 

Read more: https://lnkd.in/gYYS9Z9y

üïµÔ∏è‚ôÇÔ∏è Can you detect a Pass the Hash attack in your AD?
Attackers looking for a way into Active Directory have a wide range of methods to choose from. Pass the Hash is a favorite. 

This attack method lets bad actors gain access quickly and move laterally to infiltrate your systems. And because they look like a real user, they are hard to detect. 

Learn why EDR and ITDR solutions are invaluable for spotting attempts to steal credentials‚Äîgiving you the means to halt attackers before they can take over key user accounts.

üí° What‚Äôs better for incident response: greenfield or brownfield recovery?
A greenfield Active Directory deployment means you start fresh‚Äîbut is rarely practical. Brownfield recovery restores and secures the existing AD environment, balancing security, cost, and business continuity. 

BUT: Brownfield recovery requires highly specialized expertise in identity security.

Identity Forensics & Incident Response (IFIR) provides the focus and expertise required to identify and eliminate threats‚Äîwhile keeping business operations running.

Semperis is honored to announce that Jen Easterly, former Director of the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), will deliver the keynote address at the 2025 Hybrid Identity Protection Conference (HIP Conf), taking place October 7‚Äì9 in Charleston, SC.

A globally recognized leader in cybersecurity and national defense, Jen Easterly‚Äôs impact on the industry is unmatched. During her tenure at CISA, she led the agency through a period of unprecedented growth and transformation‚Äîexpanding it into a $3 billion operation with over 10,000 personnel and solidifying its role as a cornerstone of U.S. cyber defense.

Easterly‚Äôs career spans combat service, executive leadership at Morgan Stanley, and groundbreaking work in public and private sector cybersecurity. Her insights at HIP Conf 2025 will be invaluable for any organization navigating the growing complexity of hybrid identity security and operational resilience in today‚Äôs threat landscape.

We are thrilled to welcome Jen to the HIP community and to spotlight the practitioners and first responders on the front lines of identity-first security.

üóìÔ∏è Save the date: October 7‚Äì9, 2025
üìç Charleston, South Carolina
üîó Register now: https://lnkd.in/g-Z9DPCM

It‚Äôs the final day of #Infosec2025. After a week filled with conversations, connections, and castle vibes, we‚Äôre not done yet! üí™

The Semperis squad is back at it and ready for one last day of action at Booth #C20. üí• Whether you‚Äôve swung by already or today‚Äôs your first visit, we'd love to hear about your cyber resilience strategy or how you assess your security posture.

And whether or not you're familiar with Purple Knight, you can still nab yourself some Shadow Realm trading cards. Better yet, can you guess your way through MITRE ATT&CK riddles? You'll have to visit the booth and play the game to find out...

üö® Big day ahead at #Identiverse tomorrow!

Alex Weinert is hitting the stage three times on Thursday‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss this triple threat of identity security insight, real-world war stories, and cutting-edge attack analysis.
üé§ 9:30 AM ‚Äì Keynote: 5 Lessons From 15 Years of Defending Microsoft Identity
üé§ 10:30 AM ‚Äì Innovation Workshop Panel
üé§ 4:00 PM ‚Äì Federated Forgery: Golden SAML and Beyond

Whether you‚Äôre defending Entra ID or building the next wave of identity innovation, these sessions are a can‚Äôt-miss.

Remember to stop by Booth 913 to score some sweet, sweet Shadow Realm trading cards. If you're wondering if you should know what they are...you should. Guess you'll just have to visit the booth to find out. üòâ

Semperis‚Äô Operation 999 tabletop exercise today at #Infosec2025 offered a highly effective, immersive experience for honing cyber incident preparedness, similar to how war games train military forces during peacetime.

The red team participants simulated a cyberattack on a fictional UK water utility serving 1 million residents. The blue team of defenders protected the utility, minimizing disruptions and ensuring the water supply remains uninterrupted.

In the water industry, a cyberattack isn't just a data breach, it's a potential environmental, economic, and geopolitical crisis. Clean water systems are the foundation of modern life. Yet we assume they are safe in someone else‚Äôs hands. They aren‚Äôt. Strengthening our defenses and eliminating criminal threats are a priority.

Great insights from Alex Weinert during today‚Äôs ‚ÄúDigital Identity on Defense‚Äù panel at #Identiverse! üîê

The panel explored how today‚Äôs identity systems don‚Äôt adequately serve edge populations that may not have smart phones, phones of any kind, or are even literate. A recurring theme was how to protect sensitive identity data (such as biometrics) from the system administrators themselves to prevent data exposure if the new caretakers adopt different policies. Alex pointed out that password hashing was adopted for just that purpose - protecting cleartext passwords from administrators.

Catch Alex again tomorrow‚Äîthree more sessions, including a must-see keynote at 9:30 AM.

What a day at #Infosec2025! Identity threats don‚Äôt stand a chance with this crew.

The Strategy Talks Theatre buzzed as Guido Grillenmeier took the stage with a standout session on identity-first security, covering everything from protection-level agreements to Tier 0 planning. üîê

We also spotted our very own Yossi Rachman and Simon Hodgkinson in the spotlight, sharing their expertise during a filmed interview with Infosecurity Magazine. 

Over at Booth #C20, it‚Äôs been wall-to-wall activity‚Äîfrom big-screen battle sequences to deep-dive security conversations.

üì∏ Take a look at some highlights from today. If you haven‚Äôt visited yet, we‚Äôll see you at the castle tomorrow.

Have you gotten your hands on Shadow Realm game cards from Semperis and Purple Knight? Slide in to #Identiverse Booth 913 to acquire cards, drub your opponents, and expand your deck.

If you've already scored your trading cards, post a picture in the comments below to win gift cards to our swag store!

We‚Äôre excited to have our very own Guido Grillenmeier, Principal Technologist at Semperis, taking the stage at #Infosec2025 today!
Catch his ‚ÄúIdentity First: Enhancing Hybrid Identity Security with Protection-Level Agreements‚Äù session at 16:00 GMT.
üìç Don‚Äôt miss it!
